title: Meth arrest: Moonta man to face court for drugs attached with magnets
text:
A 43-year-old Moonta man will face court on Monday after Police located methamphetamine in his car.

On Saturday afternoon patrols stopped a car on East Tce in Moonta, and after searching his vehicle found a container holding 50 grams of methamphetamine – fixed to the underside of his car’s chassis with magnets.

A further search of the man and his house uncovered 14 grams of methamphetamine.

The latest United Nations Illicit Drug Data reports the median street value of one gram of methylamphetamine in 2017 was $457 in Australia – making this total haul worth about $30,000.

The man was charged with trafficking a controlled drug, and was refused bail.

He will appear in the Port Pirie Magistrates court on Monday.

Also this weekend, a drug driver was caught speeding on the Eyre Peninsula.

At about 4pm on Sunday, police stopped a vehicle on Flinders Hwy at Coomunga for exceeding the speed limit.

The 35-year-old Port Lincoln man provided a positive drug reading to methamphetamine and checks to the man’s licence found he was disqualified from driving.

He was reported for exceeding the speed limit and driving disqualified.

His vehicle was impounded for 28 days, and his drug test will be sent to Forensic Science SA to be analysed. Pending the result, he may be further charged with drug driving and will appear in court at a later date.

Anyone with information of the manufacture, sale and possession of illegal drugs should call crime stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: Police have arrested a man who was allegedly transporting methamphetamine  fixed to the underside of his car with magnets.
